WorkItem.Description:
Right now wpp uses all the default update classifications when publishing updates (see screenshot). If one has a auto allow rules for those classifications in state in wsus, every custom gets automatically approved. It would be nice to have a custom update classification like Application or something similar. This would not get autoapproved by WSUS.

Regards
Norbert

Comments.Message:
[Update Classification](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.updateservices.administration.packageupdateclassification(v=vs.85).aspx)  is a hard-coded enumeration in the API.
This can not be extended.

Yes I see, I actually meant http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.updateservices.administration.packagetype(v=vs.85).aspx ;)

Regards
Norbert

Norbert, do you mean Application in this Article? http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.updateservices.administration.packagetype%28v=vs.85%29.aspx

Regards
Winfried
Yes. There seems to be a difference, how WSUS handles Update Package Type and Application Package.

We will fall in the same problem. PackageType is a hard-coded enumeration, so can't be modify.

I could surely add an option to prevent Wsus to apply Automatic Approval Rules to locally published updates.
Is it possible to publish packages of application package type?
Yes it is possible. I seem to remember that there is a difference between Application and Update, but I can't remember  what it is.

So, how is it possible with the released Version? I seem to miss the right option for this.

Regards
Norbert
With the current release, it's not possible. Use the one that I hae sent you yesterday.
